gt_summary: Buy a new stem and handle for your tub. Screw the stem onto the faucet pipe. Slide your new handle over the stem and screw it in place.
pred_summary: If you're replacing your faucet, bring the old stem and handle with you to the store to ensure a proper fit. You can buy stems and handles in the plumbing section of your local home improvement store, and some stores sell kits that come with stems and handles for easy installation. Once you have the stem, screw in a new stem for each handle, and then attach the handle by tightening the screwdriver.

gt_summary: Start holding the barre in first or fifth position. To prep for practice, go to passé en relevé. Plié and dèveloppé front. Open your leg to the side, or à la seconde. Bring everything in at once. Once you have those three moves down, do a pirouette.
pred_summary: The text describes a barre exercise for beginners that focuses on the passé and relevé positions. The exercise starts with the right foot in passé position and the left hand on the bar, with the core tight and hips down. The exercise then moves into relevé position and back to passé, with the right arm in first position and the left arm in second position.

gt_summary: Create a solution with warm water and mild dish soap. Submerge your crystal in the solution. Rinse thoroughly. Apply a bit of toothpaste to remove mineral deposits on the crystal. Cover crystal in a mixture of vinegar and salt to remove deposits. Dry your crystal.
pred_summary: The article provides instructions on how to clean crystal items using a solution of warm water and mild dishwashing soap, a toothpaste substitute, and a mixture of vinegar and salt for more stubborn residue. It also recommends using a rubber mat, soft cloth, or paper towels to line the bottom of the sink or bucket to prevent damage to the crystal. The article advises to be gentle when cleaning crystal and to wear gloves to prevent smudging.

gt_summary: Measure out four tablespoons calcium (carbonate) powder. Add two tablespoons baking soda. Include ½ teaspoon of stevia. Sprinkle in one teaspoon sea salt. Mix all of the ingredients together.
pred_summary: Adding calcium to your toothpaste can help rebuild calcium in your teeth. Baking soda reduces acid content in your mouth, sea salt adds minerals to the tooth powder, and stevia adds flavor. Mixing these ingredients together in a bowl creates a tooth powder that can be stored in a mason jar until ready for use.
